Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2007 10:29AM CMFR wrote: Some people are idiots. See my other post. This is a direct quote from my mother in law when I sent her an email telling her how upset and stressed my husband is: "I knew he was upset by the tone of his voice. You two will be just fine through this." She's a nurse. Hello, we aren't just fine. We are completely freaked. How about a little support here? This is your son going through a crisis.
Posts.Title: The comments Bendcoles WendyInCalif

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2008 03:41AM CMFR wrote: I ended up with a rash that started about 3 weeks after rads ended. I still have it 3-4 weeks later. It doesn't really itch. My rads onc and surgeon don't know what it is. I have tried Jean's Cream, aloe, vitamin E, Aquafor, and hydrocortisone... The surgeon said let's see what happens but it doesn't look like cancer and he will biopsy it if I still have it when I see him next.
Posts.Title: itchy red bumps-like hives Pam40 Pam40

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2009 08:09AM CMFR wrote: Never give up hope! Have you been for second opinions anywhere? Have you asked your onc about clinical trials? There are more and more new treatments every day. This is a very hard road you are on but you can do it.
Posts.Title: Fourth year mark...and fell like im slowly losing. rooni LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2007 01:31PM CMFR wrote: I have not told anyone yet other than my husband because I am not ready to talk. However I have started a blog that I plan on using to keep everyone posted on my progress. I have lots of distant friends and relatives and don't want to be on the phone all the time. I also want my parents to take their annual vacation - they are elderly and may not be able to for many more years - and they have a laptop and will be able to follow my progress from a distance as well.
